description.raw:
Add an option to `gztopic echo` that prints messages on a single line, which is useful for command-line parsing.

Currently `gztopic echo /gazebo/default/world_stats` outputs human-readable formatting with messages on multiple lines:
~~~
sim_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 218000000
}
pause_time {
  sec: 0
  nsec: 0
}
real_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 363079642
}
paused: false
iterations: 17218

sim_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 413000000
}
pause_time {
  sec: 0
  nsec: 0
}
real_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 563192487
}
paused: false
iterations: 17413
~~~

With this pull request, `gztopic echo -u /gazebo/default/world_stats` would output the following, with each message on a single line:
~~~
sim_time { sec: 197 nsec: 357000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 198 nsec: 846875458 } paused: false iterations: 197357
sim_time { sec: 197 nsec: 557000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 199 nsec: 47136552 } paused: false iterations: 197557
sim_time { sec: 197 nsec: 757000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 199 nsec: 247788813 } paused: false iterations: 197757
~~~
This lets you do fun command-line filtering. For example, if you want to output csv, you can use the following:
~~~
gztopic echo /gazebo/default/world_stats -u | \
  sed -e 's@[a-zA-Z_\{\}:]*@@g' -e 's@^ *@@' -e 's@  *@,@g'
~~~
~~~
201,576000000,0,0,202,185685673,201576
201,776000000,0,0,202,386284097,201776
201,977000000,0,0,202,587381368,201977
~~~
I also removed a bit of code that attempted to take program arguments from stdin. This was causing problems (issue #795), so this should fix that issue.
description.html:
Add an option to gztopic echo that prints messages on a single line, which is useful for command-line parsing.

Currently gztopic echo /gazebo/default/world_stats outputs human-readable formatting with messages on multiple lines:

sim_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 218000000
}
pause_time {
  sec: 0
  nsec: 0
}
real_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 363079642
}
paused: false
iterations: 17218

sim_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 413000000
}
pause_time {
  sec: 0
  nsec: 0
}
real_time {
  sec: 17
  nsec: 563192487
}
paused: false
iterations: 17413

With this pull request, gztopic echo -u /gazebo/default/world_stats would output the following, with each message on a single line:

sim_time { sec: 197 nsec: 357000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 198 nsec: 846875458 } paused: false iterations: 197357
sim_time { sec: 197 nsec: 557000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 199 nsec: 47136552 } paused: false iterations: 197557
sim_time { sec: 197 nsec: 757000000 } pause_time { sec: 0 nsec: 0 } real_time { sec: 199 nsec: 247788813 } paused: false iterations: 197757

This lets you do fun command-line filtering. For example, if you want to output csv, you can use the following:

gztopic echo /gazebo/default/world_stats -u | \
  sed -e 's@[a-zA-Z_\{\}:]*@@g' -e 's@^ *@@' -e 's@  *@,@g'

201,576000000,0,0,202,185685673,201576
201,776000000,0,0,202,386284097,201776
201,977000000,0,0,202,587381368,201977

I also removed a bit of code that attempted to take program arguments from stdin. This was causing problems (issue #795), so this should fix that issue.

title.raw: Simplify command-line parsing of gztopic echo output and fix #795
title.html: Simplify command-line parsing of gztopic echo output and fix #795
